title: Chess Fundamentals
description: Test your knowledge of basic chess concepts and rules

questions.text: How does the knight move in chess?

options.text: In an L-shape: 2 squares in one direction and 1 square perpendicular
Only forward one square at a time
In any direction one square at a time

questions.explanation: The knight is unique in chess as it moves in an L-shape pattern: two squares in one direction (horizontal or vertical) followed by one square perpendicular to that direction.

options.text: Promoting a pawn to a queen
A special move involving the king and rook

questions.explanation: Castling is a special move that allows your king to move two squares towards a rook on its original square, then that rook moves to the square the king crossed.
En passant is a special pawn capture that can occur when a pawn moves two squares forward from its starting position and lands beside an enemy pawn.

options.text: When a king is under attack
When the king is in check and cannot escape capture
When only kings remain on the board

questions.explanation: Checkmate occurs when a king is in check (under attack) and there are no legal moves to escape the check, ending the game.
